variableMeasured.name: trial_type
variableMeasured.description: The name of the plugin used to run the trial.

variableMeasured.name: trial_index
variableMeasured.description: The index of the current trial across the whole experiment.

variableMeasured.name: time_elapsed
variableMeasured.description: The number of milliseconds between the start of the experiment and when the trial ended.

variableMeasured.name: success
variableMeasured.description: If `true`, then all files loaded successfully within the `max_load_time`. If `false`, then one or * more file requests returned a failure and/or the file loading did not complete within the `max_load_time` duration.

variableMeasured.name: timeout
variableMeasured.description: If `true`, then the files did not finish loading within the `max_load_time` duration. * If `false`, then the file loading did not timeout. Note that when the preload trial does not timeout * (`timeout: false`), it is still possible for loading to fail (`success: false`). This happens if * one or more files fails to load and all file requests trigger either a success or failure event before * the `max_load_time` duration.

variableMeasured.name: failed_images
variableMeasured.description: One or more image file paths that produced a loading failure before the trial ended.

variableMeasured.name: failed_audio
variableMeasured.description: One or more audio file paths that produced a loading failure before the trial ended.

variableMeasured.name: failed_video
variableMeasured.description: One or more video file paths that produced a loading failure before the trial ended.

description.html-button-response: The response time in milliseconds for the participant to make a response. The time is measured from when the stimulus first appears on the screen until the participant's response.
description.audio-slider-response: The time in milliseconds for the participant to make a response. The time is measured from when the stimulus first * began playing until the participant's response.
description.image-keyboard-response: The response time in milliseconds for the participant to make a response. The time is measured from when the stimulus * first appears on the screen until the participant's response.

description.audio-slider-response: The path of the audio file that was played.
description.categorize-html: Either the path to the image file or the string containing the HTML formatted content that the participant saw on this trial.
description.html-button-response, html-keyboard-resp: The HTML content that was displayed on the screen.
description.image-keyboard-response: The path of the image that was displayed.

description.html-button-response: Indicates which button the participant pressed. The first button in the `choices` array is 0, the second is 1, and so on.
description.audio-slider-response: The numeric value of the slider.
description.image-keyboard-response: Indicates which key the participant pressed.

variableMeasured.name: slider_start
variableMeasured.description: The starting value of the slider.

variableMeasured.name: correct
variableMeasured.description: `true` if the participant got the correct answer, `false` otherwise.

variableMeasured.name: extension_type
variableMeasured.description: The name(s) of the extension(s) used in the trial.

variableMeasured.name: extension_version
variableMeasured.description: The version(s) of the extension(s) used in the trial.
